translation: When, like the tortoise which withdraws all its limbs on all sides, he withdraws his senses from the sense-objects, then his wisdom becomes steady.
commentary: 2.58 When when? Withdraws withdraws? f and? This this (Yogi)? Tortoise: tortoise? Limbs limbs? Iv like? Absolutely everywhere? The senses the senses? from the senseobjects? his of him? Prajna wisdom Pratishthita is steadied.Commentary Withdrawal of the senses is Pratyahara or abstraction. The mind has a natural,tendency to run towards external objects. The Yogi again and again withdraws
